content.description: Start on a good undercling - trend up and right - technical crimping leads to a series of tosses on good holds! The stand is quite fun.
content.location: From the main trail/hole show: hike west up and around Haunt-a-crack. Pick your way through the oak trending uphill towards a clump of large trees... Queen Bee is right next to a large fire scarred ponderosa pine

content.description: Start on Good holds on the right side of the boulder. This problem follows positive holds finishing with a technical top out over an auspicious landing.
content.location: Right Side of the Blood Orange Boulder

content.description: Stand start matched on an incut sidepull. Climb up and left out the seam topping out similar to Blood Orange
content.location: On the Blood Orange boulder climb out the seam in the center

content.description: Stand start on good holds and make a few compression moves up the arete. Surf out right into the corner and follow the positive seam.

Sit start on opposiing sidepulls, slap your way up the small prow on beautiful orange patina. The crux involves moving through a micro crimp slot and a challenging sequence to get to better holds in the seam up and right. A power tech. test of grit and determination
content.location: From the Abies boulder, continue west for a few hundred feet. This bright orange underhang has awesome plated patina

content.description: Stand start on small opposing holds - climb up to an awesome undercling and toss to the top - finish it off with a technical mantle.
content.location: From The Hole Show hike directly to the west through a small oak patch - walk up the hill past several other problems. There are a few large ponderosa pine trees up near this decent sized boulder - Abies is directly in front of a pruned fir tree.

content.description: The Queen Bee area is another nice cluster that can be more suitable in warmer temperatures, as canyon walls cast a nice shadow in the late afternoon. It also gets blasted with sun in the morning. The moderates here are certainly worth doing and offers nice views of town
